description: From Persian تنبک‎ (tonbak). Doublet of dumbek.

entries.meaning: (music) A type of goblet drum used heavily in Persian music.

description: From Dutch, from Malay tembaga (“copper”), from Sanskrit ताम्र (tāmra). Entered Dutch usage during colonial period. Doublet of tumbaga.

entries.meaning: A brass alloy also known as red-bronze. Term used where zinc content is below 28%. Usually consists of 84-90 % copper and 16-10% zinc, sometimes including arsenic to mimic gold.
